article:
If we were to keep a record of all the things we worried about during a given period of time, we would discover-in reviewing them-that the great majority of our  _  never come to pass. This means that most of the time we  _  to worrying, even the constructive kind that prompts us to try to try to come up with a   _  to what is troubling us, is wasted.  _  , we not only caused ourselves unnecessary mental pain, but also  took up  valuable minutes and hours that could have been spent elsewhere.

it is often necessary to subject(......)pltential  _  of worry to the coldly objective. Once, before a major  _  in front of a standing-room-only audience, a member off Arturo

Toscanini looked with total  _  at the man. Then he  _  kindly and placed an arm
around his shoulders."My friend,"the maestro replied,"do not worry about it.
The note E-flat does not  _  anywhere in the music that you
will be  _  this evening."
The next time we find ourselves in the middle of  _  about some matter, we might be wise to  _  and ask ourselves what the odds are of the problem really coming to  _  ,
We may be able to go on to something more constructive.
